Post-Match Reflections: Northern Ireland coach Michael O'Neill was satisfied with their 0-0 draw against Belarus.
O'Neill mentioned that Northern Ireland played well in the first half, were dominant and played good football.
He stated that they just needed that first goal to change the game's pattern.
O'Neill noted that they are not a high-scoring team and will need to find ways to win.
The team kept a clean sheet and didn't get beaten, with a good shape in and out of possession.
O'Neill acknowledged that with a young team, there are learnings and improvements to be made.
